block.p: Billie Tekel, a costume jewelry wholesaler in New York, and Barry Elias, a sales executive at Maylis Textiles in New York, were married yesterday in Huntingdon Valley, Pa. Rabbi Simeon J. Maslin officiated at the Philmont Country Club.

Mrs. Elias, 37 years old, graduated from Columbia University and received a master's degree in operations research from Stanford University. She is the daughter of Dr. Ralph Tekel of Elkins Park, Pa., and Pearl Miller of Philadelphia. Her father, who is retired, was a professor of organic chemistry at La Salle College in Philadelphia. Her mother, also retired, owned Critics' Choice, a restaurant in Wyncote, Pa. The bride is a stepdaughter of Lillian T. Tekel.

Billie Tekel, a costume jewelry wholesaler in New York, and Barry Elias, a sales executive at Maylis Textiles in New York, were married yesterday in Huntingdon Valley, Pa. Rabbi Simeon J. Maslin officiated at the Philmont Country Club.

Mrs. Elias, 37 years old, graduated from Columbia University and received a master's degree in operations research from Stanford University. She is the daughter of Dr. Ralph Tekel of Elkins Park, Pa., and Pearl Miller of Philadelphia. Her father, who is retired, was a professor of organic chemistry at La Salle College in Philadelphia. Her mother, also retired, owned Critics' Choice, a restaurant in Wyncote, Pa. The bride is a stepdaughter of Lillian T. Tekel.

Mr. Elias, 31, graduated from the State University of New York at Binghamton, where he was elected to Phi Beta Kappa. He is the son of Martin and Anita Elias of North Woodmere, L.I. His father is the production manager of Lloyd Sportwear, a maker of women's clothing in New York.
A report on Aug. 31 about the wedding of Billie Tekel and BarryElias misidentified the clergyman. Rabbi Alexander Levin performed the ceremony, substituting at the last minute for a colleague.
